intro: Ctenium cirrosum var. ondulatum, commonly known as the wavy-haired ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is often covered in fine, hair-like structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to attract beneficial insects.
